title: How to Uninstall iCloud for Windows

steps.title: Click the Windows Start button .
steps.content: Click the Windows Start button . It's typically in the lower-left corner of the screen in the taskbar. This opens the Windows Start menu.

steps.title: Type iCloud.
steps.content: Type iCloud . This searches for the iCloud app in the Windows Start menu. The iCloud icon will be displayed at the top of the Windows Start menu. It has a blue logo that resembles a white cloud.

steps.title: Click on iCloud.
steps.content: Click on iCloud . It appears at the top of the Windows Start menu when type "iCloud." Click this icon to launch iCloud.

steps.title: Select the data to back up.
steps.content: Select the data to back up. Do so by checking the boxes next to "iCloud Drive," "Photos," "Mail, Contacts, Calendars, and Tasks," and/or "Bookmarks."

steps.title: Click on Apply.
steps.content: Click on Apply . It's in the lower-right corner of the dialog box. This saves all the data you selected to your iCloud account.

steps.title: Click on Sign out.
steps.content: Click on Sign out . When your data has finished uploading, sign out with the button in the lower-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click the Windows Start button .
steps.content: Click the Windows Start button . It's typically in the lower-left corner of the screen in the taskbar. This opens the Windows Start menu. Using the Control Panel to uninstall iCloud will remove the bulk of the program. However, some residual files may still be left behind. Using a program like Revo Uninstaller will uninstall the program and search for residual files and registry items left behind. Uninstalling iCloud requires an admin password. If you're not logged into your PC as an admin, log out and log back in as an admin.

steps.title: Type Control Panel.
steps.content: Type Control Panel . This searches for the Windows Control Panel in the Start menu.

steps.title: Click Control Panel.
steps.content: Click Control Panel . It appears at the top of the Windows Start menu when you type "Control Panel." It has an icon that resembles a computer screen with a pie chart.

steps.title: Click Uninstall a program.
steps.content: Click Uninstall a program . It's in the "Programs" section of the Control Panel dialog box. On Windows 7 or XP, click on Programs and then click on Program and Features . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Check the "iCloud" box.
steps.content: Check the "iCloud" box. All programs are listed alphabetically.

steps.title: Click on Change.
steps.content: Click on Change . It's above the pane that contains the list of programs. It's at the top of the list of programs in the center. On Windows 7 or XP, click on Uninstall .

steps.title: Click on Ok.
steps.content: Click on Ok . This dialog box confirms you want to make a change to iCloud.

steps.title: Click on the "Remove" radio button.
steps.content: Click on the "Remove" radio button. It's the second option in the dialog box.

steps.title: Click on Next.
steps.content: Click on Next . It's in the lower-right of the dialog box.

steps.title: Click on Yes.
steps.content: Click on Yes . Doing so confirms that you want to uninstall iCloud from your PC.

steps.title: Click on Finish.
steps.content: Click on Finish . iCloud for Windows has now been uninstalled and deleted from your PC. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Download and install Revo Uninstaller.
steps.content: Download and install Revo Uninstaller. Then click Next . Select and install location and click Next . Check or uncheck "Create a desktop shortcut" and click Next . Click Install .

steps.title: Create a System Restore Point
steps.content: Create a System Restore Point . Since Revo Uninstaller will search your system files and registry for residual files left behind, it's a good idea to create a system restore point before doing an uninstall using Revo Uninstaller. This allows you to return to your current system configuration if Revo accidentally uninstalls any critical files or registry items. The Pro version of Revo Uninstaller lets you create a restore point using the app. If you are using the free version, go ahead and use the following steps to create a system restore point: Click the Windows Start menu. Type "Create a Restore Point." Click Create a Restore Point in the Windows Start menu. Click the hard drive Windows is installed on. Click Create . Type a name for the restore point. Click Create .

steps.title: Close all programs and apps that are running.
steps.content: Close all programs and apps that are running. It's a good idea to close all apps that are running before you uninstalling any programs with Revo Uninstaller. Click any programs running in the taskbar and click the "X" icon, or click the option to close the program in the File menu.

steps.title: Open Revo Uninstaller.
steps.content: Open Revo Uninstaller. To open Revo Uninstaller, click the Windows Start menu and type "Revo." You should see Revo Uninstaller appear at the top of the Windows Start menu. Click Revo Uninstaller to open it. It has an icon that resembles the contents of a box going into a trash bin with an "R" on it.

steps.title: Click Windows Apps.
steps.content: Click Windows Apps . It has an icon that resembles the Windows logo. It's the second option in the Panel at the top. This will load a list of Windows apps installed on your computer. Allow a few minutes for it to load.

steps.title: Scroll down and click iCloud.
steps.content: Scroll down and click iCloud . All programs are listed in alphabetical order. Scroll down and click the iCloud app to select it.

steps.title: Click Uninstall.
steps.content: Click Uninstall . It's the button that resembles a Window with an "X" on it at the panel at the top. Click this icon to uninstall the program.

steps.title: Click Continue.
steps.content: Click Continue . It's the button in the lower-right corner. This will launch a PowerShell window that will automatically run the command to uninstall iCloud. If Revo Uninstaller launches an uninstaller app, follow the instructions to finish the install process.

steps.title: Click Scan.
steps.content: Click Scan . This option is displayed at the bottom of Revo Scanner once iCloud is finished installing. Click this option to scan for residual files left over. Allow a few minutes for Revo Scanner to finish scanning your system.

steps.title: Uncheck any items you don't want to delete.
steps.content: Uncheck any items you don't want to delete. Look over the list of leftover files and registry items that Revo Uninstaller lists. Uncheck any items that you don't want to uninstall.

steps.title: Click Delete.
steps.content: Click Delete . This deletes all the leftover registry items found by Revo Uninstaller.

steps.title: Click Finish.
steps.content: Click Finish . This closes Revo Uninstaller. You have successfully uninstalled iCloud and deleted any residual files leftover.
